intro: Aciotis acutiflora var. parvifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved aciotis, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are narrow and linear, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clustered inflorescences. It is often found in regions with mild temperatures and well-drained soils.
